name: Outer Isles Archipelago
role_in_state: coastal reagent entrepôt and pilotage hub
culture_adjustments: boat-house identity supersedes inland kin networks
keepers maintain proprietary oral charts and laws
stricter seasonal voyage taboos and rites
practical sea-rituals dominate over formal merchant liturgy
high seasonal population flux; floating/temporary households common
constraints: limited arable land — heavy import dependence
ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents
navigational auguries cannot replace charts; keepers control access
notes: no major burgs; population clustered in skerries and boat-houses
serves as state pilot-training ground and reagent transshipment point
